snp1.6:2.1: Several of the examples are gendered so I use “man”.
snp1.6:2.3: Accept variant bhavantaṁ in this and similar passages. Bhagavantaṁ is hypermetrical.
snp1.6:3.1: For “easy to understand” (suvijāna) cf. Rig Veda 7.104.12 and durvijñāna at Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 11.5.5.13.
snp1.6:3.3: Dhammakāmo is apparently always used in this sense.
snp1.6:19.2: Both Norman and Bodhi read dissati, I read dussati. The Buddha, after all, was “seen” with prostitutes.
